metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10876 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Linux kernel in the ext4 filesystem code. Ause-after-free is possible in ext4_ext_remove_space() function whenmounting and operating a crafted ext4 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10876` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-lowlatency - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1028-aws - 4.4.0-1028.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-azure - 4.15.0-1037.39~14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-134.160~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1028.31').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~14.04.2').
